page.title: 11MINCHINHAMPTON - CATTLE
page.content: Cattle marking started hundreds of years ago. 278 cattle were marked in 1985 on {Minchinhampton Common,}and it takes 3 or 4 men to mark them all. Only animals from farms registered under the{Common Registration Act of 1965} are allowed to graze. (The animals also use Rodborough Common. The most popular breed of cattle is the{friesian.}There are relatively few pure bred cattle on the Common because they are mainly{cross bred.} The maximum number of cattle allowed on the Common is 400. It costs Â£4 each for{horses}and{cattle}to graze and Â£2 for{goats.}The other animals allowed on the Common are{sheep}and{pigs.} Goats have tethers which have to be 15 yards from any roads or footpaths.
